verses.kjv: Blow ye the trumpet in Zion, and sound an alarm in my holy mountain: let all the inhabitants of the land tremble: for the day of the LORD cometh, for it is nigh at hand;
verses.web: Blow the trumpet in Zion, and sound an alarm in my holy mountain! Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble, for the day of LORD comes, for it is close at hand:
verses.ct: Sound the trumpet in Zion! Blast the alarm on my holy mountain! Let everyone in the land tremble, because the day of the LORD is coming — it's almost here.

verses.kjv: A day of darkness and of gloominess, a day of clouds and of thick darkness, as the morning spread upon the mountains: a great people and a strong; there hath not been ever the like, neither shall be any more after it, even to the years of many generations.
verses.web: A day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness. As the dawn spreading on the mountains, a great and strong people; there has never been the like, neither will there be any more after them, even to the years of many generations.
verses.ct: It will be a day of darkness and gloom, a day of heavy clouds and deep shadow. Like dawn spreading across the mountains, a massive and powerful army approaches. Nothing like it has ever existed before, and nothing like it will ever come again for generations upon generations.

verses.kjv: A fire devoureth before them; and behind them a flame burneth: the land is as the garden of Eden before them, and behind them a desolate wilderness; yea, and nothing shall escape them.
verses.web: A fire devours before them, and behind them, a flame burns. The land is as the garden of Eden before them, and behind them, a desolate wilderness. Yes, and no one has escaped them.
verses.ct: Fire devours everything ahead of them, and flames burn everything behind them. Before they arrive, the land looks like the garden of Eden. After they pass through, it's a ruined wasteland. Nothing escapes them.

verses.kjv: The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses; and as horsemen, so shall they run.
verses.web: Their appearance is as the appearance of horses, and they run as horsemen.
verses.ct: They look like horses, and they charge like cavalry.

verses.kjv: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of mountains shall they leap, like the noise of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble, as a strong people set in battle array.
verses.web: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of the mountains, they leap, like the noise of a flame of fire that devours the stubble, like a strong people set in battle array.
verses.ct: They leap across the mountaintops with a sound like rumbling chariots, like the roar of fire consuming dry stubble — like a mighty army lined up for battle.

verses.kjv: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.
verses.web: At their presence the peoples are in anguish. All faces have grown pale.
verses.ct: Nations writhe in anguish at the sight of them. Every face goes pale with terror.

verses.kjv: They shall run like mighty men; they shall climb the wall like men of war; and they shall march every one on his ways, and they shall not break their ranks:
verses.web: They run like mighty men. They climb the wall like warriors. They each march in his line, and they don’t swerve off course.
verses.ct: They charge like warriors. They scale walls like soldiers. Each one marches in formation, never breaking ranks.

verses.kjv: Neither shall one thrust another; they shall walk every one in his path: and when they fall upon the sword, they shall not be wounded.
verses.web: Neither does one jostle another; they march everyone in his path, and they burst through the defenses, and don’t break ranks.
verses.ct: They never shove each other aside. Each one stays in its own lane. They burst through defenses without breaking their lines.

verses.kjv: They shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the windows like a thief.
verses.web: They rush on the city. They run on the wall. They climb up into the houses. They enter in at the windows like thieves.
verses.ct: They swarm through the city. They race along the walls. They climb into houses and slip through windows like thieves.

verses.kjv: The earth shall quake before them; the heavens shall tremble: the sun and the moon shall be dark, and the stars shall withdraw their shining:
verses.web: The earth quakes before them. The heavens tremble. The sun and the moon are darkened, and the stars withdraw their shining.
verses.ct: The earth shakes before them. The heavens tremble. The sun and moon go dark, and the stars stop shining.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall utter his voice before his army: for his camp is very great: for he is strong that executeth his word: for the day of the LORD is great and very terrible; and who can abide it?
verses.web: LORD thunders his voice before his army; for his forces are very great; for he is strong who obeys his command; for the day of LORD is great and very awesome, and who can endure it?
verses.ct: The LORD thunders his voice at the head of his army. His forces are beyond counting, and the one who carries out his command is mighty. The day of the LORD is great and utterly terrifying — who can endure it?

verses.kjv: Therefore also now, saith the LORD, turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning:
verses.web: “Yet even now,” says LORD, “turn to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning.”
verses.ct: "But even now," declares the LORD, "come back to me with all your heart — with fasting, weeping, and mourning."

verses.kjv: And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the LORD your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.
verses.web: Tear your heart, and not your garments, and turn to LORD, your God; for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, and relents from sending calamity.
verses.ct: Tear your hearts open, not just your garments, and return to the LORD your God. He is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and overflowing with kindness. He relents from sending disaster.

verses.kjv: Who knoweth if he will return and repent, and leave a blessing behind him; even a meat offering and a drink offering unto the LORD your God?
verses.web: Who knows? He may turn and relent, and leave a blessing behind him, even a meal offering and a drink offering to LORD, your God.
verses.ct: Who knows? He may turn and relent, leaving behind a blessing instead — grain offerings and drink offerings for the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Blow the trumpet in Zion, sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly:
verses.web: Blow the trumpet in Zion! Sanctify a fast. Call a solemn assembly.
verses.ct: Sound the trumpet in Zion! Declare a holy fast. Call everyone together for a solemn assembly.

verses.kjv: Gather the people, sanctify the congregation, assemble the elders, gather the children, and those that suck the breasts: let the bridegroom go forth of his chamber, and the bride out of her closet.
verses.web: Gather the people. Sanctify the assembly. Assemble the elders. Gather the children, and those who nurse from breasts. Let the bridegroom go out of his room, and the bride out of her room.
verses.ct: Gather all the people. Set the congregation apart as holy. Bring together the elders. Gather even the little children and nursing infants. Let the bridegroom leave his room and the bride leave hers.

verses.kjv: Let the priests, the ministers of the LORD, weep between the porch and the altar, and let them say, Spare thy people, O LORD, and give not thine heritage to reproach, that the heathen should rule over them: wherefore should they say among the people, Where is their God?
verses.web: Let the priests, the ministers of LORD, weep between the porch and the altar, and let them say, “Spare your people, LORD, and don’t give your heritage to reproach, that the nations should rule over them. Why should they say among the peoples, ‘Where is their God?’ ”
verses.ct: Let the priests who serve the LORD weep between the temple porch and the altar. Let them pray, "Spare your people, LORD! Don't let your own people become an object of scorn. Don't let the nations rule over them. Why should the peoples say, 'Where is their God?'"

verses.kjv: Then will the LORD be jealous for his land, and pity his people.
verses.web: Then LORD was jealous for his land, And had pity on his people.
verses.ct: Then the LORD burned with passion for his land and took pity on his people.

verses.kjv: Yea, the LORD will answer and say unto his people, Behold, I will send you corn, and wine, and oil, and ye shall be satisfied therewith: and I will no more make you a reproach among the heathen:
verses.web: LORD answered his people, “Behold, I will send you grain, new wine, and oil, and you will be satisfied with them; and I will no more make you a reproach among the nations.
verses.ct: The LORD answered his people, "Look — I am sending you grain, new wine, and olive oil. You will have more than enough. I will never again make you an object of mockery among the nations.

verses.kjv: But I will remove far off from you the northern army, and will drive him into a land barren and desolate, with his face toward the east sea, and his hinder part toward the utmost sea, and his stink shall come up, and his ill savour shall come up, because he hath done great things.
verses.web: But I will remove the northern army far away from you, and will drive it into a barren and desolate land, its front into the eastern sea, and its back into the western sea; and its stench will come up, and its bad smell will rise.” Surely he has done great things.
verses.ct: I will drive the northern army far away from you, pushing it into a barren, desolate land — its front ranks into the eastern sea and its rear guard into the western sea. Its rotting stench will rise, because it overstepped its bounds."

verses.kjv: Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice: for the LORD will do great things.
verses.web: Land, don’t be afraid. Be glad and rejoice, for LORD has done great things.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, O land! Be glad and celebrate, because the LORD has done great things.

verses.kjv: Be not afraid, ye beasts of the field: for the pastures of the wilderness do spring, for the tree beareth her fruit, the fig tree and the vine do yield their strength.
verses.web: Don’t be afraid, you animals of the field; for the pastures of the wilderness spring up, for the tree bears its fruit. The fig tree and the vine yield their strength.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, you wild animals, because the open pastures are turning green again. The trees are bearing fruit. The fig trees and grapevines are producing abundantly.

verses.kjv: Be glad then, ye children of Zion, and rejoice in the LORD your God: for he hath given you the former rain moderately, and he will cause to come down for you the rain, the former rain, and the latter rain in the first month.
verses.web: “Be glad then, you children of Zion, and rejoice in LORD, your God; for he gives you the early rain in just measure, and he causes the rain to come down for you, the early rain and the latter rain, as before.
verses.ct: Celebrate, people of Zion! Rejoice in the LORD your God! He has given you the autumn rains in just the right measure, and he will send both the autumn and spring rains as before.

verses.kjv: And the floors shall be full of wheat, and the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
verses.web: The threshing floors will be full of wheat, and the vats will overflow with new wine and oil.
verses.ct: The threshing floors will be heaped with wheat, and the vats will overflow with new wine and olive oil.

verses.kjv: And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you.
verses.web: I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, the great locust, the grasshopper, and the caterpillar, my great army, which I sent among you.
verses.ct: "I will make up for the years that the swarming locusts devoured — the great locusts, the young locusts, and the crawling locusts — my massive army that I sent against you.

verses.kjv: And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the LORD your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed.
verses.web: You will have plenty to eat, and be satisfied, and will praise the name of LORD, your God, who has dealt wondrously with you; and my people will never again be disappointed.
verses.ct: You will eat until you're full and satisfied, and you will praise the name of the LORD your God, who has done incredible things for you. My people will never be put to shame again.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, and that I am the LORD your God, and none else: and my people shall never be ashamed.
verses.web: You will know that I am among Israel, and that I am LORD, your God, and there is no one else; and my people will never again be disappointed.
verses.ct: Then you will know that I am present among Israel, that I am the LORD your God and there is no other. My people will never be put to shame again.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions:
verses.web: “It will happen afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh; and your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your old men will dream dreams. Your young men will see visions.
verses.ct: After all this, I will pour out my Spirit on everyone. Your sons and daughters will prophesy. Your old men will have dreams. Your young men will see visions.

verses.kjv: And also upon the servants and upon the handmaids in those days will I pour out my spirit.
verses.web: And also on the servants and on the handmaids in those days, I will pour out my Spirit.
verses.ct: Even on servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days.

verses.kjv: And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.
verses.web: I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth: blood, fire, and pillars of smoke.
verses.ct: I will display wonders in the heavens and on the earth — blood, fire, and columns of smoke.

verses.kjv: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and the terrible day of the LORD come.
verses.web: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and terrible day of LORD comes.
verses.ct: The sun will turn to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and terrifying day of the LORD arrives.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the LORD shall be delivered: for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem shall be deliverance, as the LORD hath said, and in the remnant whom the LORD shall call.
verses.web: It will happen that whoever will call on LORD’s name shall be saved; for in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be those who escape, as LORD has said, and among the remnant, those whom LORD calls.
verses.ct: But everyone who calls on the name of the LORD will be saved. On Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be deliverance, just as the LORD has promised — among the remnant that the LORD calls.
